desc: SH2B3 encodes an adaptor protein that regulates growth factor and cytokine signaling. Mutations are found in hematopoietic disorders including leukemias and myeloid disease.

SH2B3 (or LNK) encodes the SH2B adaptor protein 3 that modulates signaling from growth factor and cytokine receptors. It functions mainly as a negative regulator of signal transduction (PMID:11805142, 18753636). SH2B3 is implicated in B-cell development, T-cell activation, and hematopoietic stem cell prolifereation and differentiation (PMID:11114373, 10799879, 11805142). Polymorphisms in SH2B3 are associated with autoimmune disease such as diabetes and celiac disease and hypertension (PMID:19430479, 18311140, 19073967). Germline variants can be associated with autoimmunity and predisposition to leukemia (PMID:23908464). SH2B3 mutations are found in Down syndrome related myeloid disorders, acute lymphoblastic leukemias, and myeloproliferative neoplasms (PMID:24056718, 22897847, 20404132, 22237106).
